intro: Malope intermedia, commonly known as the common malope, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in soft, hairy foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly rough texture. Malope intermedia is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils.
